results.title: The Strange love of Martha Ivers
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas made his film debut and Barbara Stanwyck starred as the malevolent Martha Ivers in this melodrama cum thriller which engages the viewer until its gripping climax. A strong supporting cast includes Lizabeth Scott, Van Heflin and Judith Anderson. Martha Ivers is a wicked but powerful woman who runs the town of Iverson after inheriting the family fortune. However, Martha has a deadly secret which threatens to ruin her life. As a teenager, Martha was responsible for the murder of her domineering Aunt so she could elope with her lover and the past has a way of catching up her despite her efforts to keep it buried.

results.title: Until the end of the world
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Kim Vecara, Argos Films, Road Movies Filmproduktion and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Wim Wenders combines his many obsessions in this bizarre and intricate science-fiction tale spanning three continents. An outstanding Solveig Dommartin plays a woman who is searching for a stranger (William Hurt) to whom she is attracted. All she knows is that he is undertaking a dangerous mission for his scientist father (Max Von Sydow). Her search takes her through an end-of-the millineum Europe and Asia in which technology and consumerism has run riot. She traces the stranger to Australia where beneath the desert soil, a group of First Nations and European scientists are hoping to create a society which will save mankind. Combining exceptional graphics, a film noir palette and a metaphysical reflection on alienation and colonial exploitation, “Until The End of the World” is a difficult but exhilerating film. Co-starring Jeanne Moreau and Ernie Dingo and featuring a stunning soundtrack including U2, Lou Reed, Nick Cave, Neneh Cherry, Can and REM.

results.title: Looking for Mr. Goodbar (E)
results.creator_credit: Richard Brooks, Freddie Fields and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Judith Rossner, Theresa Dunn (Dianne Keaton) is a “nice Catholic girl”. By day she is a compassionate teacher of deaf children, but by night, she seeks the uninvolved sexual experiences to be found by cruising the Singles Bar scene. Keaton’s portrayal of Theresa is powerful; vacillating between fragility, insecurity, and obsession on the one hand, and confidence, manipulation and hedonism on the other. Theresa is on a journey to escape her family and her upbringing in order to find herself and her “Mr Goodbar”. Ultimately, the journey is both unfulfilling and unenlightened as Theresa makes the wrong choice one night and pays for it with her life. “Looking for Mr. Goodbar” redefined female roles, as it dealt with a central character who was neither the stereotypical “tramp” or “lady” of traditional female roles.

results.title: Living free
results.creator_credit: Jack Couffer, Paul Radin, Carl Foreman and Columbia
results.brief_description: The sequel to “Born free” continues the adventures of Joy and George Adamson. Elsa the lioness brings her three cubs out of the wilderness to the couple who raised her. When Elsa suddenly dies, the cubs who cannot fend for themselves, attack domestic animals to survive before disappearing into the wild. The Adamson’s launch a desperate attempt to find the young lions and bring them to the safety of the game reserve. Starring Susan Hampshire and Nigel Davenport.

results.title: Gypsy
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Philip Anderson, Mervyn LeRoy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gypsy Rose Lee, burlesque Queen of renown, was driven to stardom much less by her own ambition, than by the ruthless determination of her mother. As the stereotypical domineering “stage mother”, Rosalind Russell’s performance is superb, while Karl Malden as her long-suffering but loyal lover also gives a fine performance. While the references to striptease are undeniably fleeting, Natalie Wood as Gypsy Rose Lee is creditable, but it is her vulnerability rather than her sex appeal which comes to the fore. Stephen Sondheim’s lyrics and Julie Styne’s score makes this a musical delight.

results.title: The Pink panther
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Martin Jurow, Blake Edwards Productions and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: Peter Sellers debuts in the role that made him a legend and launched a number of sequels. As the bumbling Inspector Clouseau, Seller’s own particular brand of comedy comes to the fore. The film takes its title from the rare “Pink Panther” Diamond owned by Princess Dala (Claudia Cardinale). Debonaire David Niven is intent on stealing the jewel and Clouseau must foil this plot. The film also stars Capucine as Clouseau’s none too faithful wife and Robert Wagner as her lover. Henry Mancini’s theme tune and the cartooned figure of the Pink Panther himself add acclaim to this hilarious film.

results.title: Paint your wagon
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Alan Jay Lerner and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood star in this famous film version of the the stage musical. Ben Rumson (Lee Marvin) is a hard-fighting, hard-drinking, happy-go-lucky man. His ‘Pardner’ (Clint Eastwood) on the other hand is sober, quiet and gentle. The story follows their adventures in a lawless gold mining town called No Name City (population: drunk). They stick together through thick and thin and share everything including a wife (Jean Seberg). Music and lyrics by Alan J. Lerner and Frederick Loewe

results.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
results.creator_credit: Curtis Bernhardt, Jerry Wald and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham’s “Rain”, a steamy story of sex, sin and salvation in the tropics. Set in the 1940s, it is the story of a bawdy nightclub entertainer, Sadie (Rita Hayworth) and Alfred Davidson (Jose Ferrer), a puritanical preacher waging an anti-sin campaign in the Pacific Islands. When Sadie falls in love with a straight-arrow marine (Aldo Ray), she seeks Davidson’s help in reforming her life. Tragically, the repressed cleric reacts with disbelief and, ultimately violence.

results.title: The Party
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Mirisch Corporation and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Blake Edwards and Peter Sellers combine in another comic masterpiece. This time Sellers is not the bumbling Closeau, but the much maligned and accident-prone Indian actor Hrundi V. Bakshi. Hollywood mogul, Fred Clutterbuck is giving the Hollywood party of the century, complete with beautiful women, powerful men and “wanna-be stars.” Blackballed by his producer for wrecking a day’s shooting, Bakshi finds himself unexpectedly invited to the party. Once this walking disaster area enters the festivities, destruction and mayhem follows. A satire on the artifice and snobbery of Tinseltown and a must for lovers of Sellers’ unique comic style. Co-starring Claudine Longet, Marge Champion and Steve Franken with a musical score by Henry Mancini.

results.title: Bloodlust
results.creator_credit: Jon Hewitt, Richard Wolstencroft and Windhover Productions
results.brief_description: The most controversial and acclaimed cult hit since “Mad Max.” Banned in seven countries including Britain, “Bloodlust” is the tale of three modern day vampires on a bullet-riddled rollercoaster to hell. Winner Finalist Award “Best Film” Worldfest Housten, Texas. Starring John Stuart Wallace, Kelly Chapman, Robert James O’Neill and Phil Motherwell. Music by Revolting Cocks, Pailhead, Lead into Gold and 100 Homo DJ’s.
